measured_by: Center for Epidemiologic Studies Depression Scale (CES-D)
justification: “The Center for Epidemiologic Studies Depression Scale (Radloff, 1977) includes 20 items on the frequency of various symptoms of depression….”

measured_by: Satisfaction With Life Scale (SWLS)
justification: “The Satisfaction With Life Scale (SWLS; Diener et al., 1985) contained 5 items… rated from 1 to 7.”

measured_by: Pennebaker Inventory of Limbic Languidness (PILL)
justification: “The Pennebaker Inventory of Limbic Languidness (PILL; Pennebaker, 1982) includes 54 physical symptoms… we employed a summed total….”

measured_by: Positive and Negative Affect Schedule (PANAS) – positive subscale
justification: “The Positive and Negative Affect Scale (PANAS; Watson, Clark, & Tellegen 1988) includes 30 … positive (e.g., happy, energetic)….”

measured_by: Positive and Negative Affect Schedule (PANAS) – negative subscale
justification: “The Positive and Negative Affect Scale (PANAS… includes 30 negative (e.g., frightened, upset)….”

measured_by: 60-item NEO Inventory
justification: “The 60-item NEO (McCrae & Costa, 2004) was used to assess the five personality traits….”

measured_by: 44-item Big Five Inventory (BFI)
justification: “The 44-item Big Five Inventory (John & Srivastava, 1999) was used to assess the five personality traits….”

measured_by: Growth coding scheme (4-point) adapted from Bauer et al., 2005
justification: “The coding of growth … captured the extent to which a sense of positive personal growth was described… Growth was rated on a four-point scale….”

measured_by: Exploratory Processing coding scheme (Pals, 2006)
justification: “Exploratory processing (Pals, 2006) was defined as the extent to which a person openly analyzes and explores the meaning of past events… rated on a four-point scale….”

measured_by: Meaning-making coding scheme (McLean & Pratt, 2006)
justification: “Meaning is defined as the degree to which the participant narrates self-knowledge… Narratives were coded on a four-point scale.”

measured_by: Self-Event Connection coding system (Pasupathi et al., 2007)
justification: “Each narrative was coded for the presence of four types of self-event connections (see Pasupathi et al., 2007).”

measured_by: Facts coding scale (0–3) adapted from Pasupathi & Hoyt, 2009
justification: “Narratives were coded on a 0… to three… scale for facts… (adapted from Pasupathi & Hoyt, 2009).”

measured_by: Interpretations coding scale (0–3) adapted from Pasupathi & Hoyt, 2009
justification: “Narratives were coded on a 0… to three… scale for … interpretations (adapted from Pasupathi & Hoyt, 2009).”

measured_by: Reese et al. (2012) coherence coding scheme (context, chronology, theme)
justification: “The coherence of the narratives was evaluated with a coding scheme developed by Reese et al. (2012).”

measured_by: 5-point Affective Tone coding system
justification: “Affective tone captures the overall emotional tone of narratives… This coding system relies upon a five-point scale….”

measured_by: 5-point Ending Valence coding (adapted from Pals, 2006)
justification: “Adapted from coding for positive resolution (Pals, 2006), the valence of the ending of the narrative was coded using a five-point scale….”

measured_by: Redemption coding based on beginning-to-end valence shift (McAdams et al., 2001)
justification: “Redemption is defined as a narrative that begins in a negative state… and ends in a positive state… This coding system was applied… (McAdams et al., 2001).”

measured_by: Contamination coding based on beginning-to-end valence shift (McAdams et al., 2001)
justification: “Contamination is the reverse – the story begins in a positive… and ends in a negative state… coded with a movement from three to two, three to one, or two to one.”

measured_by: Agency coding scheme (0–4 scale)
justification: “Narratives high in agency… are coded on a zero to four scale… (ICCs ranged from .77 – .84 across datasets).”

measured_by: Communion coding scheme (0–4 scale)
justification: “Narratives high in communion… are scored on a zero to four scale… (ICCs ranged from .78 – .84 across datasets).”
